messageBody:
That's exactly what I was looking for!
Thanks a lot Chris,
As you see, i'm pretty new to JUnit :-)

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Chris Dollin <kers@h...> wrote:
> On Wednesday 09 March 2005 15:12, tonylaq79 wrote:
> > Hi all,
> > how can I run the same test many time but with a paramater ?
> >
> > What I want :
> > I want to run a particular test with a string as parameter.
> >
> > Ex
> > public void testAdd(String primKey){
> > //here I get the value to add from a DB using the primKey.
> > ResultSet rs = DB.executeQuery("Select * from blabla where
> > testcaseid=" + primKey);
> >
> > //Do the test using the resultset in a generic way.
> > }
> >
> >
> > What I want is add all the test I want in the testsuite but I cant
> > find a way to do it...
>
> This is the Parametrised Test pattern thingy, isn't it?
>
> * suppose your test class is TestSpoo.
>
> * give the TestSpoo constructor an [extra] argument:
>
> public TestSpoo( [String nameIfLegacy,] String primKey ) ...
>
> * remember the primKey in a field of TestSpoo
>
> protected String primKey;
>
> * use the field in your test case:
>
> public void testAdd() { testAdd( primKey ); /* or inline */ }
>
> * when you construct the test suite, add specific TestSpoo
instances to
> it:
>
> TestSuite answer = ...
> answer.addTest( new TestSpoo( [legacy,] "somePrimKey" );
> answer.addTest( new TestSpoo( [legacy,] "someOtherPrimKey" );
>
>
> --
> Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
